subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
The general objective of the project is to provide support for decision making and capacity building in the area of information, communication technologies. It provides techinical assistance in the form of an advisor to the Minister and supports implementation of strategic initiatives of the Mozambique Science, Technology and Inovation Strategy. The implemented activities are directed at strengthening the institutional and human capacity of the ministry to (1) facilitate mainstreaming of ICT's and Science & Technology to Government Policies, (2) to accelerate introduction of new innovations to national science, technology and inovation system, (3) to support establishment of new partnership and (4) to support implementation of Mozambique e-Government strategy, for the attainment of the following outputs:
1. Mozambique Research and Education Network established for the national higher Education and research Institutions (MoReNet)
2. Capacity of the Ministry of Science and Technology strengthened to implement the Mozambique Science, Technology and Innovation Strategy (MOSTIS)
subproject.title: ICT ADVISER for MCT - OUTPUT6

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
From 2007 to 2009 this project was mainly dedicated to support the establishment of the National Programme for Decentralized Planning and Finance (N-DPFP). From 2010 until the end of cycle in December 2011 this project will be dedicated in one hand to the follow up of the implementation of the N-DPFP through the provision of financial and technical support. TA to be allocated at Central level (Ministry of Planning and Development) and to Nampula Cabo Delgado provinces ensuring best practice generation and upstream policy work. Support also will be given to the establishment of a Decentralization and Local Development Knowledge Management System. CPAP expected results will be achieved through the achievement of specific N-DPFP outputs.
CPAP 2.1.1 Participatory planning, monitoring and evaluation processes and capacities strengthened in focus districts and municipalities 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
1.1	Studies carried out to improve the political, legal and strategic decentralized
1.2 Tools to support decentralized planning and finance operations
2.2: Strategic Planning at local level consolidated
2.3: Integrated and harmonized Planning at local level
CPAP 2.1.5	Fiscal decentralization and public financial management improved at local level and N- 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
 3.1: Capacities of implementation and management of public investment
3.3: Financial, budgetary and administrative matters including the ability to generate own revenue collection improved
CPAP 2.1.7	District and provincial government monitoring and evaluation system developed/ strengthened.
CPAP 2.2.3	Increased level of access to public services at provincial and district level, 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
1.3 Operational tools for monitoring and evaluation (PNPFD Product 1.3)
5.1 Knowledge management and information enhanced at all levels
5.2 Good Practices recorded, systematized and forwarded to the Ministry of Planning and Development
CPAP 2.2.1	Community organization developed and the IPCCs strengthened in the selected communities.
CPAP 2.2.2 Strengthened development of the capacities of communities and institutions with regards to community participation and consultation in the selected provinces and districts. 

N-DPFP OUTPUTS
 2.1: Communities active involvement of in local development process Guaranteed
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.title: Support National PPFD

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
Gaza project was created upon Province request for support after 3 consecutive years of floods, from 2000 to 2002 that seriously affected the province at all levels. Currently after 5 years of intervention the province has achieved substantive and satisfactory results both in terms of governance and food security. Despite still a separate project it is being implemented as integrated part of the National Programme for Decentralized Planning and Budget approved in late 2010 that addresses a complex set of local governance and development challenges including participation, accountability or LED among others. CPAP expected results will be achieved through the achievement of specific N-DPFP outputs.
CPAP 2.1.1 Participatory planning, monitoring and evaluation processes and capacities strengthened in focus districts and municipalities 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
2.2: Strategic Planning at local level consolidated
2.3: Integrated and harmonized Planning at local level
CPAP 2.1.5	Fiscal decentralization and public financial management improved at local level and N- 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
 3.1: Capacities of implementation and management of public investment
3.3: Financial, budgetary and administrative matters including the ability to generate own revenue collection improved

CPAP 2.1.7	District and provincial government monitoring and evaluation system developed/ strengthened.
CPAP 2.2.3	Increased level of access to public services at provincial and district level, 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
1.3 Operational tools for monitoring and evaluation (PNPFD Product 1.3)
5.1 Knowledge management and information enhanced at all levels
5.2 Good Practices recorded, systematized and forwarded to the Ministry of Planning and Development

CPAP 2.1.8 A Greater access/facilities created for the development of business in the selected areas with PME (Nampula, Cabo Delgado and Gaza).
N-DPFP OUTPUT
3.2 Activities in SDDS integrated LED's - PESOD's and implemented 
(This activity is to be implemented in close coordination with UNDP ARTPAPDEL Programme)

CPAP 2.2.1	Community organization developed and the IPCCs strengthened in the selected communities.
CPAP 2.2.2 Strengthened development of the capacities of communities and institutions with regards to community participation and consultation in the selected provinces and districts. 
N-DPFP OUTPUTS
 2.1: Communities active involvement of in local development process Guaranteed
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.title: LDP Gaza

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
Under overall Mozambique Public Sector Reform programme (PSRP) Decentralization is considered as key and critical for effective local governance, service delivery and development. In that regard UNDP has been providing support to the Ministry of State Administration in the development f required decentralization policy and legal framework as well as to its implementation. Specific support has been given to LOLE (Local Organs Law ) its implementation as well as to other policy documents such as  the PEND (National Decentralization Policy and Strategy) among others. CPAP expected results will be achieved through specific outputs
CPAP 2.1.2: All provincial and district governments restructuring according to the Law 8 / 2003 and its Regulations promoted and supported
CPAP 2.1.3: Sectoral coordination mechanisms for the public functions de-concentration process to local levels: Administrative Posts, localities and villages strengthened
CPAP 2.1.4: Structuring the supporting organs of the State Administration in the territories Municipal
CPAP 2.1: MAE strengthened technical capacity in the areas of policy formulation on Decentralization, coordination within and between sectors of the process of decentralization
CPAP 2.1: Profiles updated district, provincial profiles prepared and retrieved GIS
CPAP 2.1: International Conference on Decentralization organized in Maputo 
CPAP 2.1: South South cooperation triangular (UNDP/Moz/Brasil) promoted as foreseen under SIFAP (National Training System for Public Servants)
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.title: Public Sector Reform /LOLE

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
The joint United Nations Millennium Village Project aims at establishing a relation between Science and Technology and integrated rural development to strengthen communities and district authorities capacities in the development, planning, implementation and Monitoring and Evaluation of infrastructure and services, over a minimum of a three-year timeframe. 
The Project will create capacities through the provision of systematic goods, training, monitoring and evaluation and Information Communications Technologies as well as development of and access to markets. The villages initially exposed to the project will later be acting as training of trainers and suppliers of goods to the neighbouring communities in order to accelerate impact and to promote local partnerships and economies.
The activities will be coordinated and combined with existing decentralised development planning tools and interventions in order to scale-up planned interventions, aiming at contributing to the following outputs:

1.	Increased agricultural production and productivity in the Village
2.	Improved  access to education and quality social services
3.	Improved access to health, water and sanitation
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Support Millenium Villages

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description: This is done by using a Local Economic Development (LED) focus in strategic and participatory planning in Mozambique. The programme is coordinated nationally by the Ministry of State Administration, through the National Directorate for the Promotion of Rural Development (DNPDR) within UNDP National Implementation Modality. The Program aims to cover all territories in Mozambique and ART-PAPDEL is in the Cabo Delgado, Nampula, Gaza and Inhambane Provinces. Its main purpose is to operationalize the Action Plan for the Reduction of Absolute Poverty and the attainment of MDGs (PARPA II), which, amongst its goals, it encourages “rural development as the process of improving living conditions and of pro-rural transformation of the pattern of wealth creation and accumulation in Mozambique”. ART-PAPDEL’s strategy foresees the strengthening of technical, human and institutional capacities in LED at the different levels as well as an active and efficient coordination amongst LED actors.  At the local and national level, ART-PAPDEL’s expected results are strengthening institutions relevant for LED; including the LED approach into local planning processes; promoting and supporting business initiatives; establishing local coordination mechanisms; establishing knowledge in LED management system as well as drawing up and approving a LED Strategic Plan. At the international level, the programme include participation in/or organisation of events in order to draw together the LED actors in dynamic networks of knowledge in the spirit of South-South, North-South and South-North cooperation.
donor_long: Agencia Catalana de Cooperación al Desar
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: ART PAPDEL Mozambique

title: Support to Local Government Effectiveness and Efficiency
